author: randomishwalk
content: You do raise a good point on cartel formation and IRL market practices (cornering the market / outright collusion / using non-public info, basically what whales do often in less well trafficked ethereum DeFi protocols) that are clearly banned in most credible meat space economies that are either rampant in crypto or are nascent but likely to be rampant and cause negative externalities for all other users. The question of what is or isn’t “legitimate” network activity begins to get murky i think once you go beyond blatant manipulation of gas market mechanisms

author: randomishwalk
content: I suppose this comes down to a couple issues: 1) protocol and incentive design (this point of this discord), 2) crypto education (the point of many other orgs within and beyond ethereum), and 3) fuzzy but very important alignment of cultural/social values that dictate onchain behavior (yes we need to design cryptoeconomic/cryptographic secure networks but values are impt too imo). But sorry this is veering off into a tangent. Back into my hole now
